verb.description: (of an animal) shed old feathers, hair, or skin, or an old shell, to make way for a new growth.
examples: the adult birds were already molting into their winter shades of gray

noun.description: A loss of plumage, skin, or hair, especially as a regular feature of an animal's life cycle.

origin: Middle English moute, from an Old English verb based on Latin mutare to change. For the intrusive -l-, compare with words such as fault.
